affiliation_name: The ATMOSA Group of Companies Limited
overview:
Joseph Michael Gyulay has been involved in funding enterprises with seed stage and first round investments with entrepreneurs engaged in the development and research of scientific products. Global investments with a special focus on products designed for security, information technology, applications and advanced hardware for government agencies, military and law enforcement.

Philanthropy

In 1986, Joseph created non-profit organizations focused on education, health care and human services, the Arts and other community projects. In addition to cultural concerns, support flowed into environmental efforts and animal welfare.

In 2006, his interest in cultural and educational philanthropy moved towards seeking projects that help create open democratic societies, foster freedom of the press and respect for human rights. Projects that encourage economic growth and job opportunities as a way to stabilize and reduce poverty. Development of sustainable farming and agricultural products.

In 2008, the Hesperina Group was formed as a private philanthropy service funding charitable organizations throughout Southeast Asia. Hesperina provides research about charitable giving programs and offer management services for individuals, foundations and trusts. The Hesperina Singapore network of carefully chosen international charities are dedicated to providing healthcare and educational services throughout Southeast Asia.
